names.pinyin: zi yin qian yang fang jia jian
names.english: modified enrich yin and subdue yang formula
names.commonEnglish: Modified Enrich Yin and Subdue Yang Formula

actions: Tonifies the Liver and Kidneys, nourishes the Blood and nourishes Jing.
Nourishes and tonifies Liver and Kidney Yin and clears Deficiency Heat.
Nourishes the Blood, astringes Yin, calms Liver Yang and Liver Wind and alleviates pain.
Tonifies the Blood, enriches Yin andgenerates Fluids.
Nourishes Yin, anchors Yang, benefits the Kidneys and nourishes the Blood.
Anchors Liver Yang, benefits Yin, nourishes the Kidneys and augments the Liver.
Calms the Liver, anchors Yang and drains Liver Fire.
With Nu Zhen Zi and Ci Shi, for headaches and dizziness from Liver Yang Rising.
Calms the Liver, anchors Yang, dredges Liver Qi and disperses Stagnation and clumping.
Invigorates the Blood, expels Blood Stasis and nourishes Liver and Kidney Yin.
Moderates and harmonizes the harsh properties of other herbs and guides the herbs to all twelve channels.

syndromes: Liver Yin Deficiency with Liver Yang Rising

symptoms: Throbbing one-sided headache with distended feeling
Headache usually at the temples or vertex
Sensation of Heat rushing to the head
Red, dry eyes with feeling of grit in eye
Dry mouth and throat with bitter taste in mouth
manifestations.pulse: Thready and wiry or Wiry and rapid (when Yang is Rising and Excess, the pulse is forceful) P: Thready and rapid when Yang is not prominent
